meanings.definition: The act of removing or taking away something, especially money or property, without permission.
meanings.sent1: The eloinments of the jewels from the safe shocked everyone in the town.
meanings.sent2: He was caught for his eloinments of company funds and faced serious consequences.
meanings.sent3: The eloinments of cookies from the jar by the mischievous child caused a lot of trouble.
meanings.sent4: Her eloinments of time from her busy schedule left her feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent5: The eloinments of sunlight from the room made it feel dark and gloomy.

meanings.definition: The act of absconding or running away, typically to avoid paying debts or legal obligations.
meanings.sent1: The eloinments of the debtor left the creditors empty-handed.
meanings.sent2: His eloinments from the courtroom shocked everyone present.
meanings.sent3: The eloinments of the cat from the house left the family searching everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her eloinments from the party were so sudden, no one knew where she went.
meanings.sent5: The eloinments of the suspect made the police chase after him through the streets.
